                           ns = 10000, nr = FALSE, d = NULL, nnF = nn) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    !
                    
                      
  nnE <- sort(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
  nnF <- sort(nnF)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    !
                    
                      
  s <- rep(NA, ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    !
                    
                      
  n <- s

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    !
                    
                      
  nn <- sort(unique(c(nnF, nnE)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    !
                    
                      
  nL <- length(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    !
                    
                      
  Nstart <- nn[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    !
                    
                      
  Nmax <- nn[nL]

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    !
                    
                      
  if (nr && is.null(d)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
    ## set parameter d for randomly generating look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
    d <- floor(min(nn - c(0, nn[-nL])) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    !
                    
                      
  nnr <- nn

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrE <- nnE

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrF <- nnF

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
  ## simulate a clinical trial ns times

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
  for (k in 1:ns) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    !
                    
                      
    if (nr && (d > 0)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
      ## randomly generate look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
      dd <- sample(-d:d,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
        size = nL - 1, replace = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
        prob = 2^(c(-d:0, rev(-d:(-1))) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
      nnr <- nn + c(dd, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrE <- nnr[nn %in% nnE]

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrF <- nnr[nn %in% nnF]

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
    x <- stats::rbinom(Nmax, 1, p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
    j <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    !
                    
                      
    i <- nnr[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
    while (is.na(s[k]) && (j <= length(nnr))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    !
                    
                      
      if (i %in% nnrF) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    !
                    
                      
        qL <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
          x = 0, n = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    !
                    
                      
          xS = sum(x[1:i]), nS = i,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    !
                    
                      
          delta = deltaF, relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    !
                    
                      
          parE = parS, parS = parE

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    !
                    
                      
        s[k] <- ifelse(qL >= tL, FALSE, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    !
                    
                      
      if (i %in% nnrE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    !
                    
                      
        qU <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    !
                    
                      
          x = sum(x[1:i]), n = i,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    !
                    
                      
          xS = 0, nS = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    !
                    
                      
          delta = deltaE, relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    !
                    
                      
          parE = parE, parS = parS

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    !
                    
                      
        s[k] <- ifelse(qU < tU, s[k], TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    !
                    
                      
      n[k] <- i

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    !
                    
                      
      j <- j + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    !
                    
                      
      i <- nnr[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    !
                    
                      
  oc <- cbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedN = mean(n), PrStopEarly = mean(n < Nmax),

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyEff = sum(s * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyFut = sum((1 - s) * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEfficacy = sum(s, na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    !
                    
                      
    PrFutility = sum(1 - s, na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    !
                    
                      
    PrGrayZone = sum(is.na(s) / ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
  return(list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    !
                    
                      
    oc = oc, Decision = s, SampleSize = n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    !
                    
                      
    nn = nn, nnE = nnE, nnF = nnF,

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    !
                    
                      
    params = as.list(match.call(expand.dots = FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
  ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include dbetabinom.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the predictive probability that the trial will be

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' successful, with a prior distribution on the SOC

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the predictive probability of trial success given current data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Success means that at the end of the trial the posterior probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(P_E > P_S + delta_0 | data) >= thetaT. Then the

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' predictive probability for success is:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' pp = sum over i: Pr(Y=i|x,n)*I{Pr(P_E > P_S + delta|x,Y=i)>=thetaT},

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' where Y is the number of future responses in the treatment group and x is

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' the current number of responses in the treatment group (out of n).

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' Prior is P_E ~ beta(a, b), default uniform which is a beta(1,1).

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' However, also a beta mixture prior can be specified. Analogously

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' for P_S either a classic beta prior or a beta mixture prior can be

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' specified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' Also data on the SOC might be available. Then the predictive probability is

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' more generally defined as

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' pp = sum over i, j: Pr(Y=i|x,n)*Pr(Z=j|xS, nS)*I{Pr(P_E > P_S +

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' delta|x,xS,Y=i,Z=j)>=thetaT}

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' where Z is the future number of responses in the SOC group, and xS is the

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' current number of responses in the SOC group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' A table with the following contents will be

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' included in the \code{tables} attribute of the return value

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' (in the case that NmaxControl is zero):

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' i: Y=i (number of future successes in Nmax-n subjects)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' py: Pr(Y=i|x) using beta-(mixture)-binomial distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' b: Pr(P_E > P_S + delta | x, Y=i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' bgttheta: indicator I(b>thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' If NmaxControl is not zero, i.e., when data on the control treatment

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' is available in this trial, then a list with will be included with the

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' following elements:

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' pyz: matrix with the probabilities Pr(Y=i, Z=j | x, xS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' b: matrix with Pr(P_E > P_S + delta | x, xS, Y=i, Z=j)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' bgttheta: matrix of indicators I(b>thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x number of successes (in the treatment group)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n number of patients (in the treatment group)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @param xS number of successes in the SOC group (default: 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nS number of patients in the SOC group (default: 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
##' @param Nmax maximum number of patients at the end of the trial (in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
##' treatment group)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
##' @param NmaxControl maximum number of patients at the end of the trial in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
##' SOC group (default: 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
##' @param delta margin by which the response rate in the treatment group should

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
##' be better than in the SOC group (default: 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
##' @param relativeDelta see \code{\link{postprobDist}}

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
##' @param parE the beta parameters matrix, with K rows and 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
##' corresponding to the beta parameters of the K components. default is a

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
##' uniform prior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
##' @param weights the mixture weights of the beta mixture prior. Default are

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
##' uniform weights across mixture components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
##' @param parS beta prior parameters in the SOC group (default: uniform)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
##' @param weightsS weights for the SOC group (default: uniform)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
##' @param thetaT threshold on the probability to be used

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
##' @return The predictive probability, a numeric value. In addition, a

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
##' list called \code{tables} is returned as attribute of the returned number.

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
##'

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
##' @references Lee, J. J., & Liu, D. D. (2008). A predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
##' design for phase II cancer clinical trials. Clinical Trials, 5(2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
##' 93-106. doi:10.1177/1740774508089279

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
##'

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
##' @example examples/predprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
##' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
predprobDist <- function(x, n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
                         xS = 0, nS = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
                         Nmax, NmaxControl = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
                         delta = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
                         relativeDelta = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
                         parE = c(a = 1, b = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
                         weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
                         parS = c(a = 1, b = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
                         weightsS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
                         thetaT) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  ## ensure reasonable numbers

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
  stopifnot(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
    n <= Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
    nS <= NmaxControl,

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
    x <= n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
    xS <= nS

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
  ## remaining active patients to be seen:

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
  mE <- Nmax - n

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
  ## if par is a vector => situation where there is only one component

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
    ## check that it has exactly two entries

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
    stopifnot(identical(length(parE), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
    ## and transpose to matrix with one row

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    !
                    
                      
    parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
  ## if prior weights of the beta mixture are not supplied

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    !
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    !
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
    ## (don't need to be normalized, this is done in getBetamixPost)

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
  ## if parS is a vector => situation where there is only one component

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parS)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
    ## check that it has exactly two entries

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    !
                    
                      
    stopifnot(identical(length(parS), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
    ## and transpose to matrix with one row

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    !
                    
                      
    parS <- t(parS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
  ## if prior weights of the beta mixture are not supplied

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    !
                    
                      
  if (missing(weightsS)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    !
                    
                      
    weightsS <- rep(1, nrow(parS))

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
  ## now compute updated parameters for beta mixture distribution on the

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
  ## treatment proportion

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    !
                    
                      
  activeBetamixPost <- getBetamixPost(x = x, n = n, par = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
  ## now with the beta binomial mixture:

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    !
                    
                      
  py <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
    activeBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    !
                    
                      
    dbetabinomMix(x = 0:mE, m = mE, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    !
                    
                      
  if (NmaxControl == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
    ## here is the only difference to predprob.R:

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
    ## how to compute the posterior probabilities

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
    b <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    !
                    
                      
      x = x + c(0:mE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    !
                    
                      
      n = Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    !
                    
                      
      delta = delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    !
                    
                      
      relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    !
                    
                      
      parE = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    !
                    
                      
      weights = weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    !
                    
                      
      parS = parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    !
                    
                      
      weightsS = weightsS

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    !
                    
                      
    ret <- structure(sum(py * (b > thetaT)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    !
                    
                      
      tables =

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    !
                    
                      
        round(

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    !
                    
                      
          cbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    !
                    
                      
            i = c(0:mE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    !
                    
                      
            py,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    !
                    
                      
            b,

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    !
                    
                      
            bgttheta = (b > thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
          ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    !
                    
                      
          4

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
    ## in this case also data on the SOC is available!

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
    ## determine remaining sample size and probabilities of response

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
    ## counts in future SOC patients:

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    !
                    
                      
    mS <- NmaxControl - nS

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    !
                    
                      
    controlBetamixPost <- getBetamixPost(

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    !
                    
                      
      x = xS, n = nS, par = parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    !
                    
                      
      weights = weightsS

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    !
                    
                      
    pz <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    !
                    
                      
      controlBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    !
                    
                      
      dbetabinomMix(x = 0:mS, m = mS, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      
    ## determine resulting posterior probabilities:

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    !
                    
                      
    outcomesY <- x + c(0:mE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    !
                    
                      
    outcomesZ <- xS + c(0:mS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    !
                    
                      
    pyz <- b <- matrix(

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    !
                    
                      
      nrow = 1 + mE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    !
                    
                      
      ncol = 1 + mS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    !
                    
                      
      dimnames =

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    !
                    
                      
        list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    !
                    
                      
          0:mE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    !
                    
                      
          0:mS

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    !
                    
                      
    for (i in seq_along(outcomesY)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    !
                    
                      
      for (j in seq_along(outcomesZ)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    
                    
                      
        ## calculate the posterior probability for this combination

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
        ## of counts

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    !
                    
                      
        b[i, j] <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    !
                    
                      
          postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    !
                    
                      
            x = outcomesY[i],

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    !
                    
                      
            n = Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    !
                    
                      
            xS = outcomesZ[j],

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    !
                    
                      
            nS = NmaxControl,

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    !
                    
                      
            delta = delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    !
                    
                      
            relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    !
                    
                      
            parE = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    !
                    
                      
            weights = weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    !
                    
                      
            parS = parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    !
                    
                      
            weightsS = weightsS

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      
          )

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      
        ## what are the joint probabilities of active and control counts?

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
        ## => because they are independent, just multiply them

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    !
                    
                      
        pyz[i, j] <- py[i] * pz[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
    ## should we print something?

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    !
                    
                      
    ret <- structure(sum(pyz * (b > thetaT)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    !
                    
                      
      tables =

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    !
                    
                      
        list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    !
                    
                      
          pyz = pyz,

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    !
                    
                      
          b = b,

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    !
                    
                      
          bgttheta = (b > thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    !
                    
                      
  return(ret)

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      
## todo: predprobDistFail

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include dbetabinom.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the predictive probability that the trial will be

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' successful, with a fixed response rate threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the predictive probability of trial success given current data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Success means that at the end of the trial the posterior probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(P_E > p) >= thetaT,

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' where p is the fixed response rate threshold.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Then the predictive probability for success is:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' pp = sum over i: Pr(Y=i|x,n)*I{Pr(P_E > p|x,Y=i)>=thetaT}

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' where Y is the number of future responses in the treatment group and x is

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' the current number of responses in the treatment group (out of n).

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' The prior is P_E ~ beta(a, b), default uniform which is a beta(1,1).

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' However, also a beta mixture prior can be specified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' A table with the following contents will be included in the \code{table} attribute of

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' the return value:

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' i: Y=i (number of future successes in Nmax-n subjects)

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' py: Pr(Y=i|x) using beta-(mixture)-binomial distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' b: Pr(P_E > p | x, Y=i) using beta (mixture) posterior

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' bgttheta: indicator I(b>thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x number of successes

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n number of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Nmax maximum number of patients at the end of the trial

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p threshold on the response rate

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @param thetaT threshold on the probability to be above p

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parE the beta parameters matrix, with K rows and 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' corresponding to the beta parameters of the K components. default is a

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' uniform prior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @param weights the mixture weights of the beta mixture prior. Default are

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' uniform weights across mixture components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @return The predictive probability, a numeric value. In addition, a

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' list called \code{table} is returned as attribute of the returned number.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @references Lee, J. J., & Liu, D. D. (2008). A predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' design for phase II cancer clinical trials. Clinical Trials, 5(2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' 93-106. doi:10.1177/1740774508089279

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/predprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
predprob <- function(x, n, Nmax, p, thetaT, parE = c(1, 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
                     weights) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
  ## m = Nmax - n future observations

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    !
                    
                      
  m <- Nmax - n

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
  ## if par is a vector => situation where there is only one component

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    !
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
    ## check that it has exactly two entries

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    !
                    
                      
    stopifnot(identical(length(parE), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
    ## and transpose to matrix with one row

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    !
                    
                      
    parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  ## if prior weights of the beta mixture are not supplied

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    !
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
    ## (don't need to be normalized, this is done in getBetamixPost)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  ## now compute updated parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    !
                    
                      
  betamixPost <- getBetamixPost(x = x, n = n, par = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    !
                    
                      
  py <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    !
                    
                      
    betamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
    dbetabinomMix(x = 0:m, m = m, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
  ## now with the beta binomial mixture:

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
  ## posterior probabilities to be above threshold p

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    !
                    
                      
  b <- postprob(x = x + c(0:m), n = Nmax, p = p, parE = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
  ## prepare the return value

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    !
                    
                      
  ret <- structure(sum(py * (b > thetaT)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    !
                    
                      
    table =

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
      round(

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
        cbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
          i = c(0:m),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
          py,

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
          b,

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
          bgttheta = (b > thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
        ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    !
                    
                      
        4

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
  return(ret)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include predprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision cutpoints for boundary (based on predictive probability)

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' This function is used to identify the efficacy boundary and futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' boundary based on predictive probabilities, i.e.:

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Efficacy boundary: find minimum x (xU) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(P > p | x, Y) >= tT | x) > phiU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Futility boundary: find maximum x (xL) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(P > p | x, Y) >= tT | x) < phiL

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nvec  a vector of number of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Nmax  maximum number of patients at the end of the trial

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' (default: maximum of \code{nvec})

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p  threshold on the response rate

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tT  threshold on the posterior probability to be above p

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiL  futility boundary predictive probability threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiU  efficacy boundary predictive probability threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a  the alpha parameter of a beta prior of treatment group

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param b  the beta parameter of a beta prior of treatment group

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A matrix where for each sample size in \code{nvec}, this function

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' returns the maximum number of responses that meet the futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' threshold (xL), its corresponding response rate (pL), predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' (ppL) and posterior probability (postL), the upper bound of one

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' sided 95% CI for the response rate based on an

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' exact binomial test (UciL), and the same boundary parameters for efficacy:

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' the minimal number of responses that meet the efficacy threshold (xU),

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' the corresponding response rate (pU), predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' (ppL) and posterior probability (postU), the lower bound of one sided

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' 95% CI for the response rate based on exact binomial test (LciU).

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats binom.test

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/boundsPredprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords graphics

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
