                    73
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
  return(round(data.frame(nvec, z), 4))

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include dbetabinom.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the posterior probability to be above threshold assuming a beta prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' on the response rate

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the posterior probability Pr(P_E > p | data). Prior is P_E ~ beta(a, b),

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' with default set to be a uniform or beta(1,1).

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' We observed x successes in n trials and so the posterior is

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' P_E | data  ~ beta(a + x, b + n - x).

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x number of successes

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n number of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a first parameter of the beta prior (successes)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param b second parameter of the beta prior (failures)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @return The posterior probability that the response rate P_E is above a threshold p.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats pbeta

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/postprobOld.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
postprobOld <- function(x, n, p, a = 1, b = 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    !
                    
                      
  stats::pbeta(p, a + x, b + n - x, lower.tail = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the posterior probability to be above threshold,

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' with a beta mixture prior on the response rate.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the posterior probability `Pr(P_E > p | data)`. Prior is

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' `P_E ~ sum(weights * beta(parE[, 1], parE[, 2]))`, i.e., a mixture of beta priors.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' Default is one component only with uniform or `beta(1,1)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' We observed x successes in n trials. Note that \code{x} can be a vector.

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' Posterior is again a mixture of beta priors, with updated mixture weights

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' and beta parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x number of successes

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n number of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parE the beta parameters matrix, with K rows and 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' corresponding to the beta parameters of the K components. Default is a

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' uniform prior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @param weights the mixture weights of the beta mixture prior. Default are

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' uniform weights across mixture components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' @param betamixPost optional result of \code{\link{getBetamixPost}} in order

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' to speed up the computations. If supplied, this is directly used, bypassing

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' the other arguments (except \code{p} and \code{log.p} of course)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @param log.p Return the log of the probability? (default: FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @return The posterior probability that the response rate P_E is above p.

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
postprob <- function(x, n, p, parE = c(1, 1), weights, betamixPost, log.p = FALSE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    !
                    
                      
  if (missing(betamixPost)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
    ## if parE is a vector => situation where there is only one component

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
    if (is.vector(parE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
      ## check that it has exactly two entries

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    !
                    
                      
      stopifnot(identical(length(parE), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
      ## and transpose to matrix with one row

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    !
                    
                      
      parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
    ## if prior weights of the beta mixture are not supplied

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    !
                    
                      
    if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
      weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
      ## (don't need to be normalized, this is done in getBetamixPost)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
    ## now compute updated parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    !
                    
                      
    betamixPost <- getBetamixPost(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    !
                    
                      
      x = x, n = n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
      par = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    !
                    
                      
      weights = weights

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  ## now compute the survival function at p, i.e. 1 - cdf at p:

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
  ret <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
    betamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
    pbetaMix(x = p, par = par, weights = weights, lower.tail = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
  if (log.p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
    return(log(ret))

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
    return(ret)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
postprob <- Vectorize(postprob, vectorize.args = "x")

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include helpers.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate operating characteristics for RCT against SOC,

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' using the posterior probability method with beta priors

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' The randomization works as follows. According to the randomization ratio and

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' the maximum sample size, patients are allocated to the treatment and SOC

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' arms. The number of patients in the active treatment arm is rounded to the

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' next higher integer. That is, the sequence of patients is determined from

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' the start, such that the number of patients in both arms is constant across

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' trial simulations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' The randomized controlled trial (RCT) is stopped for efficacy if the

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' posterior probability to be at least deltaE better than the control is

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' larger than tU, and stopped for futility if the posterior probability to be

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' at least deltaF worse than the control is larger than tL. Otherwise the

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' trial is continued, and at the maximum sample size it may happen that no

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' decision is made ("gray zone").

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' A variation can be requested when \code{deltaF} is set to \code{NULL}. Then

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' the futility decision is made when the probability to be deltaE better than

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' the control is lower than 1 - tL.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' Returned operating characteristics in a matrix include:

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' ExpectedN: expected total number of patients in the trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' ExpectedNactive: expected number of patients with treatment

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' ExpectedNcontrol: expected number of patients with SOC

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' PrStopEarly: probability to stop the trial early (before reaching the

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' maximum sample size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' PrEfficacy: probability to decide for efficacy

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' PrFutility: probability to decide for futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' PrGrayZone: probability of no decision at the end ("gray zone")

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nn vector of look locations for efficacy. Note that the maximum sample size is

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' derived as the maximum value (latest look) in this vector.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' (if futility looks should be different, please specify also \code{nnF})

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @param pE true rate in the treatment population

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @param pS true rate in the standard of care population

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @param deltaE delta for efficacy: P(pE > pS + deltaE) should be large

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' to stop for efficacy. Must be non-negative value between 0 and 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param deltaF delta for futility: P(pE < pS - deltaF) should be large to

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' stop for futility. Must be numeric value between -1 and 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' Can also be \code{NULL}. (see details)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @param relativeDelta see \code{\link{postprobDist}}

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tL probability threshold for being below control - deltaF (default: 0.8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tU probability threshold for being above control + deltaE (default: 0.8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parE beta parameters for the prior on the control proportion

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parS beta parameters for the prior on the treatment proportion

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @param randRatio the randomization ratio (active vs. control) to be used.

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' default: 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ns number of simulations

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nr generate random look locations? (not default)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @param d distance for random looks around the look locations in \code{nn}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nnF vector of look locations for futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' (default: same as efficacy)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the following elements:

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' oc: matrix with operating characteristics (see Details section)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision: vector of the decisions made in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#' (\code{TRUE} for success, \code{FALSE} for failure, \code{NA} for no

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' decision)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' SampleSize: vector of the sample sizes in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' SampleSizeActive: vector of the patients with treatment in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' SampleSizeControl: vector of the patients with control in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' nn: vector of look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' nnE: vector of efficacy look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' nnF: vector of futility look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#' todo: would we like to return nnr instead, the actual look locations?

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#' params: input parameters for this function

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/ocRctPostprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
ocRctPostprobDist <- function(nn, pE, pS, deltaE, deltaF, relativeDelta = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
                              tL = 0.8, tU = 0.8,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
                              parE = c(a = 1, b = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
                              parS = c(a = 1, b = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
                              randRatio = 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
                              ns = 10000, nr = FALSE, d = NULL, nnF = nn) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  ## checks

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
  stopifnot(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
    is.probability(pE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
    is.probability(pS),

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
    is.probability(deltaE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
    is.bool(relativeDelta),

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    !
                    
                      
    is.probability(tL),

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    !
                    
                      
    is.probability(tU),

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
    randRatio > 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
    is.scalar(ns),

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    !
                    
                      
    is.bool(nr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!is.null(deltaF)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
    stopifnot(is.probability(abs(deltaF)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
  ## s: decision reject H0 (TRUE) or fail to reject (FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
  ##    during trial if continuing (NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    !
                    
                      
  nnE <- sort(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    !
                    
                      
  nnF <- sort(nnF)

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    !
                    
                      
  s <- rep(NA, ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    !
                    
                      
  n <- nActive <- nControl <- integer(length(s))

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    !
                    
                      
  ns <- as.integer(ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    !
                    
                      
  nn <- sort(unique(c(nnF, nnE)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    !
                    
                      
  nL <- length(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    !
                    
                      
  Nstart <- nn[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    !
                    
                      
  Nmax <- nn[nL]

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
  ## proportion of active patients:

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    !
                    
                      
  activeProp <- randRatio / (randRatio + 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
  ## determine number of active and control patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    !
                    
                      
  NmaxActive <- ceiling(activeProp * Nmax)

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    !
                    
                      
  NmaxControl <- Nmax - NmaxActive

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    !
                    
                      
  if (nr && is.null(d)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
    ## set parameter d for randomly generating look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    !
                    
                      
    d <- floor(min(nn - c(0, nn[-nL])) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    !
                    
                      
  nnr <- nn

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrE <- nnE

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrF <- nnF

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
  ## simulate a clinical trial ns times

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
  for (k in 1:ns) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    !
                    
                      
    if (nr && (d > 0)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
      ## randomly generate look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    !
                    
                      
      dd <- sample(-d:d,

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    !
                    
                      
        size = nL - 1, replace = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    !
                    
                      
        prob = 2^(c(-d:0, rev(-d:(-1))) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
      nnr <- nn + c(dd, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrE <- nnr[nn %in% nnE]

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrF <- nnr[nn %in% nnF]

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
    ## simulate sequence of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    !
                    
                      
    isActive <- sample(

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    !
                    
                      
      x = rep(c(TRUE, FALSE), c(NmaxActive, NmaxControl)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    !
                    
                      
      size = Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    !
                    
                      
      replace = FALSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
    ## simulate sequence of responses

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    !
                    
                      
    x <- stats::rbinom(Nmax, 1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    !
                    
                      
      prob = ifelse(isActive, pE, pS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
    ## start trial

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    !
                    
                      
    j <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    !
                    
                      
    i <- nnr[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    !
                    
                      
    while (is.na(s[k]) && (j <= length(nnr))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
      ## current data in both arms:

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    !
                    
                      
      xActive <- x[which(isActive[1:i])]

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    !
                    
                      
      xControl <- x[which(!isActive[1:i])]

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
      ## compute the two probabilities

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    !
                    
                      
      if (!is.null(deltaF) && i %in% nnrF) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    !
                    
                      
        qL <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    !
                    
                      
          x = sum(xControl), n = length(xControl),

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    !
                    
                      
          xS = sum(xActive), nS = length(xActive),

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    !
                    
                      
          delta = deltaF,

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    !
                    
                      
          relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    !
                    
                      
          parE = parS, parS = parE

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    !
                    
                      
      qU <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    !
                    
                      
        x = sum(xActive), n = length(xActive),

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    !
                    
                      
        xS = sum(xControl), nS = length(xControl),

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    !
                    
                      
        delta = deltaE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    !
                    
                      
        relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    !
                    
                      
        parE = parE, parS = parS

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    !
                    
                      
      if (!is.null(deltaF)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    !
                    
                      
        if (i %in% nnrF) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    !
                    
                      
          s[k] <- ifelse(qL >= tL, FALSE, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    !
                    
                      
        if (i %in% nnrE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    !
                    
                      
          s[k] <- ifelse(qU < tU, s[k], TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    !
                    
                      
        if (i %in% nnrF) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    !
                    
                      
          s[k] <- ifelse(qU <= 1 - tL, FALSE, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    !
                    
                      
        if (i %in% nnrE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    !
                    
                      
          s[k] <- ifelse(qU < tU, s[k], TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
      ## sample sizes: total and in both arms

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    !
                    
                      
      n[k] <- i

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    !
                    
                      
      nActive[k] <- length(xActive)

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    !
                    
                      
      nControl[k] <- length(xControl)

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    !
                    
                      
      j <- j + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    !
                    
                      
      i <- nnr[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    !
                    
                      
  oc <- cbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedN = mean(n),

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedNactive = mean(nActive),

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedNcontrol = mean(nControl),

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    !
                    
                      
    PrStopEarly = mean(n < Nmax),

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyEff = sum(s * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyFut = sum((1 - s) * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEfficacy = sum(s, na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    !
                    
                      
    PrFutility = sum(1 - s, na.rm = TRUE) / ns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    !
                    
                      
    PrGrayZone = sum(is.na(s) / ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    !
                    
                      
  return(list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    !
                    
                      
    oc = oc, Decision = s, SampleSize = n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    !
                    
                      
    SampleSizeActive = nActive,

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    !
                    
                      
    SampleSizeControl = nControl,

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    !
                    
                      
    nn = nn, nnE = nnE, nnF = nnF,

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    !
                    
                      
    params = as.list(match.call(expand.dots = FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    
                    
                      
  ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include predprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculate operating characteristics for predictive probability method

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' with beta prior on SOC response rate (gray zone allowed in the final analysis)

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision rule 1: The trial is stopped for efficacy if the predictive probability of a

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' successful trial is larger than phiU, and stopped for futility if it is below

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' phiL. A trial is successful if after the maximum number of patients the

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' posterior probability of the treatment being at least delta better than the

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' control is above tT. Otherwise the decision is "failure". In this case, there is no

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' gray zone.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision rule 2:A variation can be requested when skipping the argument phiL and utilizing the arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' DeltaFu, tFu & PhiFu. The trial can be stopped for futility if the predictive

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' probability of an unsuccessful trial is larger than phiFu. In this case, the

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' decision is "failure" when the posterior probability of the treatment being

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' at most deltaFu better than the control is above tFu at the maximum number of

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' patients.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' Returned operating characteristics in a matrix include:

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' ExpectedN: expected number of patients in the trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' PrStopEarly: probability to stop the trial early (before reaching the

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' maximum sample size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' PrEarlyEff: probability to decide for efficacy early

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' PrEarlyFut: probability to decide for futility early

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' PrEfficacy: probability to decide for efficacy

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' PrFutility: probability to decide for futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' PrGrayZone: probability of no decision at the end ("gray zone")

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nn vector of look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p true rate (scenario)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @param delta We want to be better than the control + delta (default: 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @param deltaFu declare futility when worse than the control + deltaW.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' Specify only when decisian rule 2 is used.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @param relativeDelta see \code{\link{postprobDist}}

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tT threshold for the probability to be above control + delta

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' at the end of the trial

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tFu threshold for the probability to be under control + deltaFu

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' at the end of the trial. Specify only when decisian rule 2 is used.

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiL lower threshold on the predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiU upper threshold on the predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiFu threshold on the predictive probability for futility. Specify only

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' when decisian rule 2 is used. phiL argument should be skipped in this case.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parE beta parameters for the prior on the treatment proportion

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @param parS beta parameters for the prior on the control proportion

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ns number of simulations

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nr generate random look locations? (not default)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' @param d distance for random looks around the look locations in \code{nn}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nnF vector of look locations for futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' (default: same as efficacy)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the following elements:

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' oc: matrix with operating characteristics (see Details section)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision: vector of the decisions made in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' (\code{TRUE} for success, \code{FALSE} for failure)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' SampleSize: vector of the sample sizes in the simulated trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' nn: vector of look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' nnE: vector of efficacy look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' nnF: vector of futility look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' params: input parameters of this function

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/ocPredprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
ocPredprobDist <- function(nn, p, delta = 0, deltaFu = delta, relativeDelta = FALSE, tT, tFu = 1 - tT,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
                           phiL = 1 - phiFu, phiU, phiFu = 1 - phiL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
                           parE = c(a = 1, b = 1), parS = c(a = 1, b = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
                           ns = 10000, nr = FALSE, d = NULL, nnF = nn) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  ## s: decision reject H0 (TRUE) or fail to reject (FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
  ##    during trial if continuing (NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    !
                    
                      
  if (phiL + phiFu != 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    !
                    
                      
    warning("Both phiL and phiFu arguments are specified, phiL will be overwrite by 1-phiFu")

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
  nnE <- sort(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    !
                    
                      
  nnF <- sort(nnF)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    !
                    
                      
  s <- rep(NA, ns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
  n <- s

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    !
                    
                      
  nn <- sort(unique(c(nnF, nnE)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    !
                    
                      
  nL <- length(nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
  Nstart <- nn[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
  Nmax <- nn[nL]

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
  if (nr && is.null(d)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
    ## set parameter d for randomly generating look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
    d <- floor(min(nn - c(0, nn[-nL])) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    !
                    
                      
  nnr <- nn

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrE <- nnE

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    !
                    
                      
  nnrF <- nnF

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    !
                    
                      
  for (k in 1:ns) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
    ## simulate a clinical trial ns times

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    !
                    
                      
    if (nr && (d > 0)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
      ## randomly generate look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    !
                    
                      
      dd <- sample(-d:d,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    !
                    
                      
        size = nL - 1, replace = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    !
                    
                      
        prob = 2^(c(-d:0, rev(-d:(-1))) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    !
                    
                      
      nnr <- nn + c(dd, 0)
